org.eclipse.californium.core.coap

Class Option

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.coap.Option
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Option>

    public class Option
extends Object
implements Comparable<Option>
    Both requests and responses may include a list of one or more options. An Option number is constructed with a bit mask to indicate if an option is Critical/Elective, Unsafe/Safe and in the case of Safe, also a Cache-Key indication. 
       0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7
 +---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+
 |           | NoCacheKey| U | C |
 +---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+
    For a given option number onum we can compute 
     Critical = (onum & 1);
 UnSafe = (onum & 2);
 NoCacheKey = ((onum & 0x1e) == 0x1c);
    CoAP defines several option numbers detailed in OptionNumberRegistry.

    Class variables number and value directly maps to CoAP request and response options as is. In CoAP specification number is an option header key as int and value is represented as a raw byte array byte[]. User must be careful when using value directly as depending on actual option, value may be empty, opaque, uint or string. For example, for uint the number 0 is represented with an empty option value (a zero-length sequence of bytes) and the number 1 by a single byte with the numerical value of 1 (bit combination 00000001 in most significant bit first notation). A recipient MUST be prepared to process values with leading zero bytes.

    Option has helper methods, namely getIntegerValue() and toValueString() taking into account actual option type and how it may be represented in a native value.

    See Also:
    OptionSet

      • toValueString

        public String toValueString()
        Renders the option value as string. Takes into account of option type, thus giving more accurate representation of an option value. Formats value as integer or string if so defined in OptionNumberRegistry. In case of option value is just an opaque byte array, formats this value as hex string.
        Returns:
        the option value as string
